content.description: Climb the remaining holds.  Be sure to have a spotter to keep your head off the wall to your back.
content.location: Start up the Mount Vernon Overlook trail.  Before leaving the ravine, head off-trail to the right (west) towards a rocky ridge opposite the Mount Vernon Overlook.  The routes are located in a gap in the ridge with a beautiful flat landing.  "What's Left?" is immediately left of the large Crack (What's Crackin'?).

content.description: Dirtyish crack, with a fun layback in the start.
content.location: Start up the Mount Vernon Overlook trail.  Before leaving the ravine, head off-trail to the right (west) towards a rocky ridge opposite the Mount Vernon Overlook.  The routes are located in a gap in the ridge with a beautiful flat landing.  Large crack in the center of the southeast facing wall.

content.description: Start on left with high left foot. Route climbs face of boulder. Mineral deposits provide positive crimps at top of boulder.
Starting low on good pockets, move up boulder with slopey edges and side-pulls.  Bottom is dirty and a little chossy.
content.location: Just to the right of Isolation Station on the same boulder.

content.description: Route follows the arete with some hand holds right.
Sit start onto small, beta intensive crimps.  Large move to the finish.  Super neat route.
content.location: Start up the Mount Vernon Overlook trail.  Before leaving the ravine, head off-trail to the right (west) towards a rocky ridge opposite the Mount Vernon Overlook.  The routes are located in a gap in the ridge with a beautiful flat landing.  "Are We There Yet?" is the furthest to the right on the south-west facing face, to the right of a large crack ("Whats Crackin'?").

content.description: Back in the woods to the right of the trail.
